dn7:1.2.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kosambiyaṃ viharati ghositārāme.
dn7:1.2.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kosambī, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
dn7:1.2.comm: This sutta depicts the events that were subsequently related by the Buddha in the previous sutta, DN 6.

dn7:1.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena dve pabbajitā—
dn7:1.3.eng: Now at that time two renunciates—

dn7:1.4.pli: muṇḍiyo ca paribbājako jāliyo ca dārupattikantevāsī yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodiṃsu.
dn7:1.4.eng: the wanderer Muṇḍiya and Jāliya, the pupil of the wood-bowl ascetic—came to the Buddha and exchanged greetings with him.

dn7:1.5.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu. Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho te dve pabbajitā bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ:
dn7:1.5.eng: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they stood to one side and said to the Buddha,

dn7:1.6.pli: “kiṃ nu kho, āvuso gotama, taṃ jīvaṃ taṃ sarīraṃ, udāhu aññaṃ jīvaṃ aññaṃ sarīran”ti?
dn7:1.6.eng: “Reverend Gotama, are the soul and the body one and the same, or is the soul one thing, the body another?”

dn7:1.7.pli: “Tena hāvuso, suṇātha sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
dn7:1.7.eng: “Well then, reverends, listen and apply your mind well, I will speak.”

dn7:1.8.pli: “Evamāvuso”ti kho te dve pabbajitā bhagavato paccassosuṃ.

dn7:2.1.eng: “Take the case when a Realized One arises in the world, perfected, a fully awakened Buddha …

dn7:2.2.pli: Evaṃ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu sīlasampanno hoti.
dn7:2.2.eng: That’s how a mendicant is accomplished in ethics. …

dn7:2.4.eng: They enter and remain in the first absorption …

dn7:2.5.pli: Yo kho, āvuso, bhikkhu evaṃ jānāti evaṃ passati, kallaṃ nu kho tassetaṃ vacanāya:
dn7:2.5.eng: When a mendicant knows and sees like this, would it be appropriate to say of them:

dn7:2.6.pli: ‘taṃ jīvaṃ taṃ sarīran’ti vā ‘aññaṃ jīvaṃ aññaṃ sarīran’ti vāti.
dn7:2.6.eng: ‘The soul and the body are one and the same’ or ‘The soul is one thing, the body another’?”

dn7:2.7.pli: Yo so, āvuso, bhikkhu evaṃ jānāti evaṃ passati, kallaṃ tassetaṃ vacanāya:

dn7:2.8.pli: ‘taṃ jīvaṃ taṃ sarīran’ti vā ‘aññaṃ jīvaṃ aññaṃ sarīran’ti vāti.

dn7:2.9.pli: Ahaṃ kho panetaṃ, āvuso, evaṃ jānāmi evaṃ passāmi.
dn7:2.9.eng: “But reverends, I know and see like this.

dn7:2.11.pli: ‘taṃ jīvaṃ taṃ sarīran’ti vā ‘aññaṃ jīvaṃ aññaṃ sarīran’ti vā …pe…
dn7:2.11.eng: ‘The soul and the body are one and the same’ or ‘The soul is one thing, the body another’. …

dn7:3.1.eng: They enter and remain in the second absorption …

dn7:3.4.pli: Yo kho, āvuso, bhikkhu evaṃ jānāti evaṃ passati, kallaṃ nu kho tassetaṃ vacanāya:
dn7:3.4.eng: When a mendicant knows and sees like this, would it be appropriate to say of them:

dn7:3.5.pli: ‘taṃ jīvaṃ taṃ sarīran’ti vā ‘aññaṃ jīvaṃ aññaṃ sarīran’ti vāti?
dn7:3.5.eng: ‘The soul and the body are one and the same’ or ‘The soul is one thing, the body another’?”

dn7:3.6.pli: Yo so, āvuso, bhikkhu evaṃ jānāti evaṃ passati kallaṃ, tassetaṃ vacanāya:

dn7:3.7.pli: ‘taṃ jīvaṃ taṃ sarīran’ti vā ‘aññaṃ jīvaṃ aññaṃ sarīran’ti vāti.

dn7:3.8.pli: Ahaṃ kho panetaṃ, āvuso, evaṃ jānāmi evaṃ passāmi.
dn7:3.8.eng: “But reverends, I know and see like this.

dn7:3.10.pli: ‘taṃ jīvaṃ taṃ sarīran’ti vā ‘aññaṃ jīvaṃ aññaṃ sarīran’ti vā …pe…
dn7:3.10.eng: ‘The soul and the body are one and the same’ or ‘The soul is one thing, the body another’. …

dn7:4.1.eng: They project and extend the mind toward knowledge and vision …

dn7:4.2.pli: yo kho, āvuso, bhikkhu evaṃ jānāti evaṃ passati, kallaṃ nu kho tassetaṃ vacanāya:
dn7:4.2.eng: When a mendicant knows and sees like this, would it be appropriate to say of them:

dn7:4.3.pli: ‘taṃ jīvaṃ taṃ sarīran’ti vā ‘aññaṃ jīvaṃ aññaṃ sarīran’ti vāti.
dn7:4.3.eng: ‘The soul and the body are one and the same’ or ‘The soul is one thing, the body another’?”

dn7:4.4.pli: Yo so, āvuso, bhikkhu evaṃ jānāti evaṃ passati kallaṃ tassetaṃ vacanāya:

dn7:4.5.pli: ‘taṃ jīvaṃ taṃ sarīran’ti vā ‘aññaṃ jīvaṃ aññaṃ sarīran’ti vāti.

dn7:4.6.pli: Ahaṃ kho panetaṃ, āvuso, evaṃ jānāmi evaṃ passāmi.
dn7:4.6.eng: “But reverends, I know and see like this.

dn7:4.8.pli: ‘taṃ jīvaṃ taṃ sarīran’ti vā ‘aññaṃ jīvaṃ aññaṃ sarīran’ti vā …pe….
dn7:4.8.eng: ‘The soul and the body are one and the same’ or ‘The soul is one thing, the body another’. …

dn7:5.1.eng: They understand: ‘… there is nothing further for this place.’

dn7:5.2.pli: Yo kho, āvuso, bhikkhu evaṃ jānāti evaṃ passati, kallaṃ nu kho tassetaṃ vacanāya:
dn7:5.2.eng: When a mendicant knows and sees like this, would it be appropriate to say of them:

dn7:5.3.pli: ‘taṃ jīvaṃ taṃ sarīran’ti vā ‘aññaṃ jīvaṃ aññaṃ sarīran’ti vāti?
dn7:5.3.eng: ‘The soul and the body are one and the same’ or ‘The soul is one thing, the body another’?”

dn7:5.4.pli: Yo so, āvuso, bhikkhu evaṃ jānāti evaṃ passati, na kallaṃ tassetaṃ vacanāya:

dn7:5.5.pli: ‘taṃ jīvaṃ taṃ sarīran’ti vā ‘aññaṃ jīvaṃ aññaṃ sarīran’ti vāti.

dn7:5.6.pli: Ahaṃ kho panetaṃ, āvuso, evaṃ jānāmi evaṃ passāmi.
dn7:5.6.eng: “But reverends, I know and see like this.

dn7:5.8.pli: ‘taṃ jīvaṃ taṃ sarīran’ti vā ‘aññaṃ jīvaṃ aññaṃ sarīran’ti vā”ti.
dn7:5.8.eng: ‘The soul and the body are one and the same’ or ‘The soul is one thing, the body another’.”

dn7:5.9.eng: That is what the Buddha said.

dn7:5.10.pli: Attamanā te dve pabbajitā bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandunti.
dn7:5.10.eng: Satisfied, the two renunciates approved what the Buddha said.
